body:
Comment 2 by **elazarl**: 
Quoting myself: "I'm not saying Go should support weird package names, but the rules for
argument parsing should be spelled out clearly in the docs.".

I might haven't been clear, so I'll rephrase.

It makes sense to support only arguments starting with hyphen to test file.

It makes less sense, but still makes sense not to support arguments ending with .go to
"go run file.go arg.go".

Never the less, *it should be written in the docs how arguments are determined*. When
poor folks like myself try to parse a go command line[0], the docs shoud explain how to
do that.

Therefor I expect a paragraph like "test arguments are all arguments from the first
argument not starting with hyphen/not ending with '.go'" in "cmd/go" documentation. 

[0] https://github.com/elazarl/gosloppy/blob/master/instrument/buildcmd.go#L60
